page.title: 15Weston_cum_Weedon
page.content: {WESTON-cum-WEEDON}is a small village of great interest; the Old Manor House or Armada House is so named as it was built in 1588, year of the abortive Spanish Armada Invasion. Amongst the prettiest cottages is the old Post Office & Stores - now closed, & Garden Cottage, being among the remaining three thatched cottages. Early 16th. Century records show the old Weston Hall as belonging to the Ovetts; the present Hall was built by the Hiccocks & passed through the female line until it was bought by Sir Sitwell Sitwell from his wife's father Col. Hely Hutchinson. It remains in the Sitwell family to this day. Those parts of the estate not owned by the Hall belong mainly to St. John's College, Oxford, being part of the endowment & the old stone farmhouses are now rented although retaining their charm.
